page.title: 08FILKINS: CLUBS
page.content: {BOWLING CLUB:}24 members meet 2 or 3 times a week. The Bowling Green was given to the Club in 1937, when the Community Centre was built. {FILKINS {FOOTBALL CLUB,}over 50 years old, has 22 members. No pavillion or amenities, but the Parish Council hopes to purchase the field to secure it for future use. The{DARTS CLUB}at the Lamb Public House has 2 ladies teams and 3 mens; 19 trophies gained last season. {FILKINS and BROUGHTON POGGS WOMENS {INSTITUTE}was founded in 1919, an early member of the movement. Membership lapsed 1931-1936, and during the war, but was restarted in 1947. Present membership averages 30. {FILKINS BELL RINGERS TEAM}was restarted by the WI in 1981, but it is now independent. The 17 handbells, played by 14 ladies, were bought by the Mens Club in 1925 ...
